Hello,

My iPhone 13 has the above problem:
The phone was purchased in a condition of 'Excellent, screen like new. No scratches.'
The phone was delivered with a display film and looked okay otherwise.
Under the film were two massive scratches, about 5mm long, hidden alongside some smaller ones.
I don't understand how something can be sent as excellent with such damage. The phone was urgently needed. All the hassle of returning it is very frustrating and would have been completely unnecessary if the phone had been correctly declared. Then I definitely wouldn't have chosen it. My previous Apple devices purchased from BackMarket were all delivered without a display film, which gave me confidence that the condition reports are always serious. Since this wasn't the case, I will be returning the phone and expecting a refund of the purchase price.

Thank you for your help,

Hi ecomobile,

Just a friendly reminder that the customer is waiting for their >>refund<<.
